commit.title: schutzbot/deploy.sh: apply podman CNI network workaround on c9s
commit.message:
schutzbot/deploy.sh: apply podman CNI network workaround on c9s

By updating the terraform ref and using newer c9s ci-runner, we started
to hit the issue that podman is falling back to using CNI network
backend when it detects existing container images in the local container
store. This is the situation for our ci-runner images, because we are
embedding container images at build time. The solution is to explicitly
set the podman network backend to 'netavark'.

Signed-off-by: Tomáš Hozza <thozza@redhat.com>

commit.title: go.mod: update osbuild/images to v0.198.0
commit.message:
go.mod: update osbuild/images to v0.198.0

tag v0.198.0
Tagger: imagebuilder-bot <imagebuilder-bots+imagebuilder-bot@redhat.com>

Changes with 0.198.0

----------------
  - defs/centos: cross-arch for s390x, ppc64le (osbuild/images#1905)
    - Author: Simon de Vlieger, Reviewers: Achilleas Koutsou, Michael Vogt
  - distro: turn all errors from distro.ValidateConfig() into warnings (osbuild/images#1904)
    - Author: Achilleas Koutsou, Reviewers: Michael Vogt, Sanne Raymaekers, Simon de Vlieger
  - test/configs: add jq to all test configs that require it (osbuild/images#1899)
    - Author: Achilleas Koutsou, Reviewers: Lukáš Zapletal, Simon de Vlieger

— Somewhere on the Internet, 2025-09-29

---

tag v0.198.0
Tagger: imagebuilder-bot <imagebuilder-bots+imagebuilder-bot@redhat.com>

Changes with 0.198.0

----------------
  - defs/centos: cross-arch for s390x, ppc64le (osbuild/images#1905)
    - Author: Simon de Vlieger, Reviewers: Achilleas Koutsou, Michael Vogt
  - distro: turn all errors from distro.ValidateConfig() into warnings (osbuild/images#1904)
    - Author: Achilleas Koutsou, Reviewers: Michael Vogt, Sanne Raymaekers, Simon de Vlieger
  - test/configs: add jq to all test configs that require it (osbuild/images#1899)
    - Author: Achilleas Koutsou, Reviewers: Lukáš Zapletal, Simon de Vlieger

— Somewhere on the Internet, 2025-09-29

---

commit.title: internal/worker: remove compat layer for exports in osbuildJob
commit.message:
internal/worker: remove compat layer for exports in osbuildJob

To support exporting multiple osbuild exports/upload targets on the
worker, the osbuild target have been moved from the osbuild Job
defintion to the osbuild Target definition by PR#2748 [0]. The PR
added a compatibility layer for the upgrade path where a mix of new
composer and old workers could be running in a deployment at the same
time. After three years, there is no deployment that we run where such
situation could happen, therefore the compatibility layer can be safely
removed.

[0] https://github.com/osbuild/osbuild-composer/pull/2748

Signed-off-by: Tomáš Hozza <thozza@redhat.com>

user.name: Ondřej Budai
user.bio: Principal Software Engineer @ Image Builder, Red Hat
